result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michaela Briane Payment

records.addlTxt:
9:05 AM Cases 22CF112, 22TR237, and 22CF97 called together.  Defendant Michaela Briane Payment appeared by phone.  Attorneys T. Gregory Amann and Eugene Harrington in court for Michaela Briane Payment.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney Harrington updates the Court: def in programming, anticipated completion in January 2023.  Atty Amann updates- no formal offer received on his cases yet.  Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
22R 002866   Bond Posted via Barron County Sheriff's Dept
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Bond to cover cases 22CF97 and 22CF112.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion. Defendant must complete her Rule 25 and participate in Effective Living Center programming.  Only the defendant's mother may pick the defendant up and bring her home.  Curfew from 8 pm to 6 am.  No contact with Brent Rud.  No contact with Linda Jorgensen's home or any of its occupants.  Defendant must reside with her mother.  Defendant must keep her attorneys apprised of progress in programming.

3:18 PM Cases 22CF97, 22CF112, and 22TR237 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michaela Briane Payment in court, in custody.  Attorneys Eugene D Harrington and Gregory Amann in court for Michaela Briane Payment. Case 22CF97 on for preliminary hearing, State calls first witness, Captain Julie Mead, who is sworn in and testifies.  Atty Harrington objects- relevance; sustained.  Atty Harrington moves to strike the answer; answer is stricken.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Harrington crosses.  State objects- leading and asked and answered; sustained.  State objects- speculation; sustained.  State objects- beyond the scope; sustained.  No redirect.  State rests and asks for bind over.  Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over.  State files information mirroring complaint.  Case 22CF112 on for preliminary hearing, State calls first witness, Patrol Sergeant Clifford Casady, who is sworn in and testifies.  Atty Amann objects; sustained.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Amann crosses.  Atty Amann asks Court to take judicial notice of the complaint regarding a wallet.  State redirects.  Atty Amann objects- relevance; DA responds; Atty Amann responds.  Atty Amann re-crosses.  State rests and asks for a bind over.  Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over.  State files information mirroring complaint.  Atty Amann argues in support of his bond motion.  Def supplements information in support of bond motion.  Discussion of programming.  State responds.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Atty Harrington references his motion, court notes errors.  Court addresses, denies the motion.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Motion for Modification of Bond
Preliminary hearing on June 13, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 02:06 PM Cases 22CF97 and 22CF112 called together.  Defendant, Michaela Briane Payment, appeared with Attorneys Eugene D Harrington (22CF97) and Gregory Amann (22CF112).  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Michaela Briane Payment appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant in custody.  Case 22CF112 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG pleas entered to misdmeanors, requests PH, WTLPH.  Atty Harrington makes record- hoping atty Amann will take both, attys to discuss off the record.  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Initial appearance on May 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Letter from WI State Public Defender

02:29 PM Cases 22CF112, 22CF97, and 22TR237 called together.  Defendant, Michaela Briane Payment, appeared with Attorney Eugene D Harrington.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Court makes record- has reviewed motion to dismiss 22CF97; Atty Harrington notes an affidavit will need to follow, needs time.  Court responds.  Discussion.  Atty Harrington does not represent in 22TR237 or 22CF112 (conflict on 112).  Def enters NG plea in TR matter.  Case 22CF97 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. WTLPH.  Discussion of bond.  22CF112 to be reset.  PD believes conflict with their office.  Court to require PD office to write letter explaining the conflict.  Initial appearance reset for 5/11/22 at 1:15 pm.
Initial appearance on May 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Email from PD to remove EH as he has a conflict.

No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.
